verbs.description: why [V: do] scents bring back memories the smell of chlorine wafts through the air suddenly you recall childhood summers spent in a swimming pool or maybe it a whiff of apple pie or the scent of the same perfume your mom used to wear our noses have a way of sniffing out nostalgia i stepped into an elevator and a bunch of people piled in behind me
